data.title: Pump.fun launches Spotlight, a utility token-backed program.
data.description:
Pump.fun has announced the launch of its Utility Token Support Program, "Spotlight," to help utility tokens without meme attributes gain more attention and liquidity to support startups and projects.

Furthermore, Pump.fun stated that the program will screen teams whose tokens have practical value within the ecosystem and are integrated into the company's long-term strategy, and will assist these teams in developing issuance plans. Applications for the Spotlight program are now open.

data.title: Romania blacklisted Polymarket for operating without a license.
data.description: Romanian authorities have blacklisted Polymarket for operating without a license. The Romanian National Gaming Authority (ONJN) determined that betting on prediction markets constituted counterparty betting, not trading. In Romania, the gambling industry is a state monopoly, and operators must apply for and obtain a license from the ONJN to operate. The ONJN director stated in a press release, "The decision to blacklist Polymarket is not related to technology, but to the law." (DL News)

data.description:
According to PANews, investment bank Macquarie has upgraded Core Scientific's (CORZ) stock rating from 'neutral' to 'outperform' after the merger with Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining company CoreWeave (CRWV) fell through. The bank also raised the target stock price by nearly 90%, from $18 to $34. Following this announcement, Core Scientific's stock rose by 4. 5% in early trading, reaching approximately $21
source: https://www.binance.com/en/square/post/31780873028722?utm_source=BinanceNewsRSS

data.description:
According to Odaily, data from Coinglass reveals that since 2013, Bitcoin has demonstrated an average return of +42. 49% in November, with a median return of +8. 81%. Over the past 12 years, Bitcoin's performance in November has seen increases in eight instances and declines in four
source: https://www.binance.com/en/square/post/31781179859682?utm_source=BinanceNewsRSS

data.title: Bitcoin's average return in November was 42.49%, while Ethereum's average return was 7.08%.
data.description: According to Coinglass data, since 2013, Bitcoin's average November return has been +42.49%, with a median November return of +8.81%. Over the past 12 years, November has seen 8 months of gains and 4 months of losses. Furthermore, since 2016, Ethereum's average November return has been +7.08%, with a median November return of +3.94%. Over the past 9 years, November has seen 5 months of gains and 4 months of losses.

data.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum November Returns Show Historical Trends
data.description:
According to Odaily, data from Coinglass reveals that since 2013, Bitcoin has demonstrated an average return of +42.49% in November, with a median return of +8.81%. Over the past 12 years, Bitcoin's performance in November has seen increases in eight instances and declines in four.

Additionally, since 2016, Ethereum has shown an average return of +7.08% in November, with a median return of +3.94%. In the last nine years, Ethereum's November performance has recorded five increases and four declines.

data.title: Goldman Sachs Reports Cryptocurrency Comprises 1% of Global Investment Portfolios
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Goldman Sachs has revealed that cryptocurrencies now account for 1% of global investment portfolios. The integration and acceptance of digital assets within traditional financial markets are increasingly on the rise.

data.title: Core Scientific's Stock Rating Upgraded Following Merger Collapse
data.description:
According to PANews, investment bank Macquarie has upgraded Core Scientific's (CORZ) stock rating from 'neutral' to 'outperform' after the merger with Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining company CoreWeave (CRWV) fell through. The bank also raised the target stock price by nearly 90%, from $18 to $34. Following this announcement, Core Scientific's stock rose by 4.5% in early trading, reaching approximately $21.7.

Analysts Paul Golding and Marni Lysaght noted in their report that previous reports and proxy suggestions indicated shareholder opposition to the merger between Core Scientific and CoreWeave, making the merger's failure unsurprising. The analysts view this outcome positively, as it allows Core Scientific greater flexibility to lease its short-term power capacity to AI tenants.

data.title: ZEC futures contracts saw their open interest surpass $600 million, setting a new all-time high, with a 24-hour increase of 42.11%.
data.description: As the price of ZEC rises, according to Coinglass data, the total open interest of ZEC futures contracts across the network has increased to 1.6421 million ZEC, with a market value exceeding $600 million, reaching $3.669 billion, a record high, representing a 24-hour increase of 42.11%. Among them, Binance's ZEC futures contracts have an open interest of 573,800 ZEC, with a market value of $234 million; Bybit's ZEC futures contracts have an open interest of 252,500 ZEC, with a market value of $103 million.

data.title: Romania Bans Polymarket Operations Over Licensing Issues
data.description: According to Foresight News, the Romanian National Gambling Office has prohibited Polymarket from operating in the country due to the absence of a gambling license. Vlad-Cristian Soare, the director of the Romanian Gambling Authority, stated that betting on future event outcomes with real money constitutes gambling and requires a license. The regulatory body is committed to preventing blockchain from becoming a tool for illegal gambling.

data.title: The US Hedera spot ETF saw a net inflow of $12.28 million in a single day; the Litecoin spot ETF saw a net inflow of $230,000 in a single day.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, on October 31st (Eastern Time), the Canary HBAR spot ETF (HBR) saw a net inflow of $12.28 million. As of press time, the Canary HBAR ETF's total net asset value was $45.93 million, with an HBAR net asset ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of HBAR's total market capitalization) of 0.55%. The Canary Litecoin ETF (LTCC) saw a net inflow of $230,000. As of press time, the Canary Litecoin ETF's total net asset value was $1.64 million, with an LTC net asset ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of LTC's total market capitalization) of 0.02%.

data.title: Canary HBAR and Litecoin ETFs See Significant Inflows
data.description:
According to Odaily, data from SoSoValue indicates that on October 31, Canary HBAR Spot ETF experienced a net inflow of $12.28 million. As of the time of reporting, the total net asset value of the Canary HBAR ETF stands at $45.93 million, with a net asset ratio of 0.55% relative to HBAR's total market capitalization.

Meanwhile, the Canary Litecoin Spot ETF saw a net inflow of $230,000. The total net asset value of the Canary Litecoin ETF is currently $1.64 million, with a net asset ratio of 0.02% compared to Litecoin's total market capitalization.

data.title: USDC Circulation Declines by $600 Million in Late October
data.description: According to Foresight News, Circle's official website reports that in the week ending October 30, USDC issuance totaled approximately 5.1 billion coins, while redemptions reached around 5.7 billion coins, resulting in a circulation decrease of about 600 million coins. As of October 30, USDC's circulation stood at approximately 75.9 billion coins, with reserve assets valued at around $76.2 billion.

data.title: US Treasury Secretary praises Bitcoin network for 17 years of continuous stable operation
data.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Bessant stated, "Seventeen years after the release of the Bitcoin white paper, the Bitcoin network is still functioning well and is more resilient than ever before. The Bitcoin network never crashes, and the Senate Democrats may have something to learn from this."

data.title: Bitcoin Network Remains Robust 17 Years After White Paper Release
data.description: According to PANews, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent recently tweeted about the enduring strength of the Bitcoin network, 17 years after the release of its white paper. Bessent highlighted that the network continues to operate smoothly and is more robust than ever. He also suggested that Senate Democrats might learn from Bitcoin's resilience.

data.title: Musk: We will launch an instant messaging app called "X Chat" with "Bitcoin-like" encryption features.
data.description: In a podcast, Musk stated plans to launch a standalone instant messaging app called "X Chat" to compete with Telegram and WhatsApp, expected to launch in the coming months. "It uses a peer-to-peer encryption system, kind of like Bitcoin. The encryption is very good; we're doing full testing," Musk added, noting that it won't have any "ad-driven" content. He pointed out that competitors like WhatsApp "target ads based on your chat content." (Cointelegraph)
